Articles.Content:
Hey guys, I've been playing the demo for about two months now and after watching kurtjmac's Let's Play series I finally thought 'screw it!' and bought the game. Waiting for the download link to be fixed right now so I'm having a send-off party on the Mun to the demo version, haha!

I'm pretty good at Photoshop so if anyone wants me to create any wallpapers or whatever let me know.

Hello TwiggyShip, welcome to the community, the download link should be fine, make sure you are looking in the right place

I just tried it myself and it seems to be working, so give that button another click and make yourself a cuppa while it downloads

Edited September 4, 2012 by sal_vager

Hey, thanks!

I just followed your link but still no luck. There's nothing written in the recently purchased products space

Edited September 4, 2012 by TwiggyShip
Okay I think I fixed it, how strange, here it is again just in case How to download from the KSP store.

Okay I think I fixed it, how strange, here it is again just in case How to download from the KSP store.

Sorry, I edited my post when it fixed! No luck, I'm afraid.

Yeah I got it wrong again, there were two html\\'s but both work now.

Anyway what you need to do is this:

At KerbalSpaceProgram.com, click Store, then login to your account.

Click on Profile, scroll down to the bottom, click Download.

Choose the KSP that suits your OS
I actually meant no luck with the Store page. There's nothing written in the box. I sent KSP a FWD of the receipt a couple of hours a go though, if that will help?
Sorry for the misunderstanding TwiggyShip, and yes that will help, It's morning over the pond so hopefully you'll receive a response by our morning.

Sorry for the misunderstanding TwiggyShip, and yes that will help, It's morning over the pond so hopefully you'll receive a response by our morning.

Ah, yes. Didn't know where KSP were based but I see now. Thanks very much Sal!

Greetings fellow Brit.

Even if no one else asks if you want to create wallpapers, do them anyway! Nothing wrong with a bit of fan art. Heck, I would like some Kerbal avatar's if you are serious in your offer.

Edited September 4, 2012 by TeasingJewel
Fixed spelling error.

Greetings fellow Brit.

Even if no one else asks if you want to create wallapapers, do them anyway! Nothing wrong with a bit of fan art. Heck, I would like some Kerbal avatar's if you are serious in your offer.

I've already run up three, I posted them somewhere in the General Discussion forum. Sure thing, only I haven't got access to 0.16 yet, and even if it comes through tomorrow won't until the late afternoon so if you want them sooner please send me your own screenshots. Otherwise I can have some made by Wednesday night/Thursday

I've already run up three, I posted them somewhere in the General Discussion forum. Sure thing, only I haven't got access to 0.16 yet, and even if it comes through tomorrow won't until the late afternoon so if you want them sooner please send me your own screenshots. Otherwise I can have some made by Wednesday night/Thursday

Look forward to seeing them.

hello from Southend England.

top tip dont use the altimeter for landing it gives sea level not hight from the ground,on the moon slow down at 3km and look for youre shadow,use that to land
I heard the English were naturals when it comes to blowing things up. Welcome to KSP!
